title: 2 dead and 1 injured after hot air balloon bursts into flames outside of Mexico City
description: Two people died and a girl was injured after the hot air balloon they were riding in caught fire near Mexico City, authorities said Saturday.

title: Saudis to cut oil production by 500,000 barrels per day
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates — Saudi Arabia said Sunday it will cut oil production by 500,000 barrels per day from May until the end of 2023, a move that could raise prices worldwide.

title: Explosion in Russian cafe kills long-time Russian military blogger, injures 15
description: An explosion tore through a cafe in the Russian city of St. Petersburg on Sunday, and preliminary reports suggested a prominent military blogger was killed and more than a dozen people were injured.

title: High activity spotted at North Korea nuclear complex after Kim’s bomb-fuel order
description: Satellite images show a high level of activity at North Korea’s main nuclear site, a U.S. think tank reported on Saturday after Kim Jong Un ordered an increase in production of bomb fuel to expand the country’s nuclear arsenal.

title: Pope Francis leads Palm Sunday Mass after hospital stay
description: Pope Francis presided over Mass in St. Peter's Square Sunday after a three-day stay at a Rome hospital for bronchitis.

title: Brittney Griner urges Biden to bring home journalist held in Russia
description: WNBA star Brittney Griner has shared her concern for Evan Gershkovich, the American journalist being held in Russia on espionage charges, and urged the Biden administration to secure his release.

title: Should we be worried by Putin's plan to station nukes in Belarus? Probably not
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin’s latest round of nuclear saber rattling has drawn condemnation from the West, but analysts say it's a tactic to raise fears of nuclear escalation.

title: Finland’s young leader is popular but faces tough reelection
description: A parliamentary election in Finland on Sunday is shaping up as an extremely close race between three parties as Prime Minister Sanna Marin’s Social Democrats fight to secure a second term running the government.

title: Israeli protests over judicial overhaul continue despite Netanyahu’s pause
description: Protests against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s judicial overhaul showed no sign of abating on Saturday, despite its suspension this week.

title: 2 women attacked with yoghurt in Iran and arrested for not covering their hair
description: President Ebrahim Raisi said on Saturday that the hijab was the law in Iran after a viral video showed a man throwing yogurt at two unveiled women in a shop near a holy Shi’ite Muslim city.
